text: Richard Freed (December 27, 1928 â€“ January 1, 2022) was an American music critic, program annotator and administrator. He was known for the concert program notes he wrote for many orchestras and ensembles in the United States. He was born in Chicago. He won a Grammy Award in 1995. Freed died on January 1, 2022 in Rockville, Maryland from a heart attack, five days after his 93rd birthday.Richard Freed, classical music critic, dies at 93 ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American music critics Category:American editors Category:Journalists from Chicago Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Writers from Tulsa, Oklahoma
title: Richard Freed
